results.title: The Car Stealers
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Services and Council of Fire and Accident Underwriters
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the problem of car theft and joy-riding by young teenagers in Australia. Points out to car owners and parents how their carelessness can be partly responsible. Shows safety devices and security checks for car-owners. Made with the co-operation of the Victorian Police.

results.title: Car maintenance and care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
A garage mechanic explains that a car remains attractive, economical, dependable, and safe to drive if the owner keeps the car in good condition. Discusses preventative measures to be followed: regular checking and servicing, listening for unusual sounds indicating engine trouble, checking instrument panel for warnings of trouble, rotating the tyres periodically, and driving carefully to safeguard brakes, tyres, transmission and springs.

results.title: Capital city
results.creator_credit: Carl Thomson, Richard Taylor, Antony Barrier and Antony Barrier Productions
results.brief_description: The City of London covers only one square mile, yet it is the most sophisticated money market in the world. Behind the tradition of the election of the Lord Mayor and the ancient Liveries Companies we are shown how the City of London sets about its complex task of providing a balanced environment for its working people and residents.

results.title: Musical forms: the canon (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action photography to illustrate the various elements of a canon. Also explores the variations of this musical form from the classical canon to a contemporary rock canon.

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.

results.title: Canadian wheat story
results.creator_credit: Beth Zinkan, Bill MacDonald, Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is the story of what happens to the great wheat crops of western Canada after the harvest. The route is traced from the farm to the town elevator, by box car to the huge concrete storage cylinders at terminal points on the Great Lakes, down the Lakes to the homes and bakeries of eastern Canada, and to the ocean ports for shipment abroad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beth Zinkan, Bill MacDonald, Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Canadian shield: Saguenay region
results.creator_credit: Werner Aellen, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film focuses on the Saguenay area of Quebvec as seen from a helicopter. From this vantage point, the size and resources - wood, water, arable land and mineral-bearing rock are easy to see. At closer range the film shows the industries and agricultural development of the region.

results.title: Canada: landform regions
results.creator_credit: Eugene Boyko, Frank Spiller, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A view of Canada from a helicopter, showing the nature and extent of the various landform regions. We see the immense spread of forest, rock and lakeland that makes up the Canadian Shield, the plains and lowlands where the industry of man is more evident, and finally, the coastal mountain ranges of the west, north and east. The influence of the geological character of the land on what people do and where they live is illustrated in closer views of industry, urban and rural, across the country. Photography: Eugene Boyko. Award: Sydney
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eugene Boyko, Frank Spiller, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Can the earth provide?
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
When the earth’s capacity to produce meat and potatoes, wheat, rice or corn is exhausted, will science be able to feed us? Sea plankton, algae, hydroponics, synthetics - all hold great potential for development. But the vital questions are: How much? How soon? Animation: Rene Jodoin, Kaj Pindal Narrated by Stanley Burke.
